collections.description: Describe which collection should be monitored for changes

persistence.description: Describe how to connect to the persistence layer, that is a MongoDB cluster

stream.description: Describe how to connect to the stream layer, that is a Kafka cluster

CollectionConfiguration.description:
Contains the properties that describe which MongoDB collection should be monitored
and how its changes should be processed.

topic.description: Name of the Kafka topic onto which change events related to this collection will be produced

namespace.description: MongoDB namespace representing a collection within a database. It is expected in the form `<database-name>.<collection-name>`.

snapshot.description:
Describe how the service should address the _snapshot_ operation, that is the whole collection content
is loaded onto the Kafka topic before producing events related to changes occurring to the collection records.

_Snapshot_ operations are usually launched the first time the service starts monitoring a collection,
when the business requires, such as when a new clean state is needed onto the Kafka topic.

By default, _snapshot_ operation is carried only when no message has
ever been written to the selected topic for this collection.

tombstone.description:
Specifies whether for each DELETE event also a _Tombstone_ event is generated.
A _Tombstone_ event is a Kafka message with a non-null key and a null payload. This
type of event enables deleting old messages not needed anymore when using the Kafka
[log compaction](https://docs.confluent.io/kafka/design/log_compaction.html#compaction-enables-deletes) policy.

SnapshotMode.description: Describe when the snapshot operation should be carried out.

oneOf.description:
Execute snapshot operation when no message
has ever been produced to the topic or when no Change Stream resume token is found

Execute snapshot operation only when no message
has ever been produced to the topic

PersistenceConfiguration.description: Configuration of the persistence layer, that is MongoDB connection string.

appName.description: Client application name, which is used to identify the application in MongoDB logs.

encoding.description: Define which type of encoding the library supports when it needs to read the actual secret value.
Define which type of encoding the library supports when it needs to read the actual secret value.

StreamConfiguration.description: Configuration of the stream layer, that is Kafka clients.

consumer.description:
Configurations related to the Kafka Consumer employed to retrieve
the latest state produced by the service alongside previous change events.

`bootstrap.servers` property MUST have the value of the corresponding property in the `producer` configuration.

producer.description:
Configurations related to the Kafka Producer for sending to Kafka topics
change events occurring on the persistence layer.

`bootstrap.servers` property MUST have the value of the corresponding property in the `consumer` configuration.
